post_text: Esther Luther, FM bus driver is retiring after 50 years of service to our Fall Mountain District. She has been driving bus #18 for half of a century, which means she has taken three generations of students to our schools. Tonight her story will be featured on Chronicle.
text: Esther Luther, FM bus driver is retiring after 50 years of service to our Fall Mountain District. She has been driving bus #18 for half of a century, which means she has taken three generations of students to our schools. Tonight her story will be featured on Chronicle.

post_text:
Thank You Fall Mountain Regional School District Staff

The FMRSD School Board would like to thank everyone for their outstanding work during this unprecedented crisis. Your dedication to your craft under the current conditions has been exemplary! Your willingness to try something different, and quickly decide if it will work, all while maintaining a positive “We can do this” attitude, shows tremendous professionalism, skills, intelligence, and dedication!

Thank you so very much!
text:
Thank You Fall Mountain Regional School District Staff

The FMRSD School Board would like to thank everyone for their outstanding work during this unprecedented crisis. Your dedication to your craft under the current conditions has been exemplary! Your willingness to try something different, and quickly decide if it will work, all while maintaining a positive “We can do this” attitude, shows tremendous professionalism, skills, intelligence, and dedication!

Thank you so very much!

post_text:
Abbey Group, our food services company, will continue to prepare breakfast and lunch for any family that would like these meals.

Meals will be available for pick up by any district student at VMS, CMS, NCCS, NWS, and WES daily beginning Tuesday at 10:00am and 2:30pm. We will offer meal pickup in Acworth from a school vehicle at 9:00am at the Village Store and 9:30 at Town Hall.

Important - To help us with food preparation counts, please complete this survey if you are interested in picking or receiving these meals.

https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSeQex5EpD-a7cf-2cT0cbMB7zC5nUymy32nmqUbGCiDDZdTjA/viewform

post_text:
1.13.20
Chesterfield PD has made DOE and HSEM aware of an attempted abduction this morning of two children on their way to school. The vehicle is reported as a dirty red van with possible NH or MA plates, with a dark skinned single male operator. The driver asked the children if they wanted a ride to a house, after refusing, the van followed the children for a short time then drove off.

This information is being shared for situational awareness to all schools in the state.

If you have information about this specific incident, please call Lt. Bomba at Chesterfield PD at 355-2000. Any incident like in your community this should be reported to your local law enforcement.

Thank you,
HSEM & DOE

post_text:
Fall Mountain School District will be closed on Monday, Dec. 2, 2019, due to expected heavy snow fall in our region.

The heaviest snow fall will happen between midnight and Monday morning. The storm will be a long duration storm and snow will fall into Tuesday morning.

At Fall Mountain, we want our students and staff to be safe during this storm. We are cancelling all schools for Monday, Dec. 2, 2019.
text:
Fall Mountain School District will be closed on Monday, Dec. 2, 2019, due to expected heavy snow fall in our region.

The heaviest snow fall will happen between midnight and Monday morning. The storm will be a long duration storm and snow will fall into Tuesday morning.

At Fall Mountain, we want our students and staff to be safe during this storm. We are cancelling all schools for Monday, Dec. 2, 2019.

post_text:
Remembering Zachary Campbell

We are all deeply saddened by the recent death of Zach Campbell. As a school community, we send our condolences to Zach’s family and friends.
Should parents, students or staff need support this weekend, members of our School Counseling staff will be available at the high school on Saturday, November 30, 2019 from 9:00 to 12:00.

Richard Towne
Principal, Fall Mountain Regional High School
Lori Landry
Superintendent, Fall Mountain Regional School District

post_text:
September 11, 2019 -

Hello, This is Superintendent Landry,

Today at approximately 11:20am we were notified that the Walpole Primary School and the Walpole Elementary School were placed in lockdown/secure campus by the Cheshire County Sheriff’s Office as a precautionary measure involving a situation in the area.

In response to this alert, we immediately enacted the emergency response plan to ensure the safety of our students and staff.

We worked closely with our local law enforcement agencies, administration and the media outlets to keep everyone informed of the situation as things progressed.

At 1:15 PM the Walpole Police Department notified us that the order had been lifted and that all activities could resume as normal.

Thank you all for your support!
Lori Landry
text:
September 11, 2019 -

Hello, This is Superintendent Landry,

Today at approximately 11:20am we were notified that the Walpole Primary School and the Walpole Elementary School were placed in lockdown/secure campus by the Cheshire County Sheriff’s Office as a precautionary measure involving a situation in the area.

In response to this alert, we immediately enacted the emergency response plan to ensure the safety of our students and staff.

We worked closely with our local law enforcement agencies, administration and the media outlets to keep everyone informed of the situation as things progressed.

At 1:15 PM the Walpole Police Department notified us that the order had been lifted and that all activities could resume as normal.

Thank you all for your support!
Lori Landry

post_text:
Notice from the Walpole NH Police Department

At this time we are asking all citizens and business's in the Walpole Business District/ down town areas to please stay inside and lock your doors. The entrance and exits to Walpole Village have been shut down. Our Department and several agencies are on the lookout for a male subject involved in an accident at the intersection of RT12 and South Street. At this time the Walpole Primary and Elementary Schools are on lockdown as well as the Nursery School / Daycare on Westminster Street. Please advise updates on the lockdown will be posted once more information is available.

post_text:
ARTICLES OF AGREEMENT COMMITTEE

Members of our 5 towns have been coming together and meeting to discuss the Fall Mountain Regional School District's Articles of Agreement.

The committee's mission is: To ensure that the Articles of Agreement are fair and equitable to all of the residents in the school district. They will be clear in how the district is organized and funded in order to deliver a quality education.

Detailed information can be found on the Fall Mountain Regional School District’s Website.

post_text:
Update - 3.11.19 at 12:30pm --
The Fall Mountain Regional High School had a water gauge failure and consequently, the water pumps did not turn on automatically as design. The pressure is being restored now and the high school will be open at regular time tomorrow.
Thank you, E. E. Houghton & Co. for coming to the rescue!
text:
Update - 3.11.19 at 12:30pm --
The Fall Mountain Regional High School had a water gauge failure and consequently, the water pumps did not turn on automatically as design. The pressure is being restored now and the high school will be open at regular time tomorrow.
Thank you, E. E. Houghton & Co. for coming to the rescue!

post_text:
Notice of Workshop -
The Fall Mountain School District is pleased to join with the Newport, Claremont and Unity School Districts to host a school funding discussion on Tuesday August 14, 2018 at 6 pm Richards Elementary School in Newport NH.

The event will be conducted by Andru Volinsky, current Executive Councilor and former lead attorney in the Claremont lawsuit and Attorney John Tobin, a partner in the Claremont lawsuit.

As the discussion about adequacy, funding, accountability, and public vs. private options for learning becomes more intense, this type of information session and discussion is important for school leaders at all levels.

We are pleased to have this discussion in the South West Region. We hope you can join us.

post_text:
As you know FMRHS was impacted by Friday’s storm. A very special thank you to all of the many crews from the Power Company and Asplund for making it possible to open our doors this Monday morning, as well as the round the clock efforts of our Bill Botting and his men.

Since there is no internet and telephone at the high school and the Early Learning Center.

To ensure everyone’s safety we will have the regularly assigned NH State Trooper on staff, as well as additional officers from local police departments throughout the day.

In the event of an emergency or if you have any questions or concerns please contact our SAU Office at 835-0006.

post_text: On Friday evening a severe wind and rain storm caused a considerable amount of damage to the road leading to our Fall Mountain High School. Crews are still working around the clock to restore power to the building and to clean the down trees in the parking area. There are some local roads that are still closed due to down trees, We are continuing to receive updates.

post_text: The four middle school students selected to place the wreath during the changing of the guard ceremony at the Tomb of the Unknown Soldier were Ruby Frithsen of Walpole Elementary, Willem Bellows of Vilas Middle, Owen Marsden of Vilas Middle, and Angel Lewis of Lempster School. The group of 55 students from Walpole, Alstead, Charlestown, and Lempster attended as part of the Camp Takodah, Cheshire YMCA trip on the American Heritage Tour to Philadelphia, Washington, D.C., Arlington Cemetery, Amish Country, PA, and Valley Forge, PA. Ten adults attended as leaders, bus coordinators, nurse, and tour director.
text: The four middle school students selected to place the wreath during the changing of the guard ceremony at the Tomb of the Unknown Soldier were Ruby Frithsen of Walpole Elementary, Willem Bellows of Vilas Middle, Owen Marsden of Vilas Middle, and Angel Lewis of Lempster School. The group of 55 students from Walpole, Alstead, Charlestown, and Lempster attended as part of the Camp Takodah, Cheshire YMCA trip on the American Heritage Tour to Philadelphia, Washington, D.C., Arlington Cemetery, Amish Country, PA, and Valley Forge, PA. Ten adults attended as leaders, bus coordinators, nurse, and tour director.

post_text:
NO SCHOOL -10/30/17 - due to trees and power lines being down in most of the Fall Mountain Regional areas.

Many of our schools have little or no power. Keeping our students and staff safe, there will be no school today.

post_text:
Lynn Lyons is a licensed clinical social worker and psychotherapist in NH. The Title I Department has sponsored Ms. Lyon's presentation on the treatment of anxiety disorders in children here at Fall Mountain.

Ms. Lyons will be presenting at -
Putney, VT, Kurn Hattin Homes for Children
26th Annual Fall Conference
Beyond Calming Down: Process-Based Strategies to Help Anxious Kids
Friday, October 20, 2017, 9:00 to 3:30
